questions.question: A grandparent's job is easier than  ..............................
Are the banks ........................... on Saturdays?
questions.description: We use open as an adjective.

questions.question: Who left the faucets ....................................?
questions.description: We do not open faucets. We turn them on.

questions.question: He ought to be here soon, ....................................?
questions.description: Contracted negative forms of ought are rare in American English.

questions.question: You ought ............................. go.
questions.description: In negative clauses not comes before to.

questions.question: He ran ................................ the room.
questions.description: The opposite of into is out of.

questions.question: I will do it in ................................ way.
questions.description: Myself does not have a possessive form.

questions.question: She lives ..................................
questions.description: When people live on their own, they live without company.

questions.question: I was very ................................... in the discussion.
questions.description: The past participle is used to say how people feel.

questions.question: I didn't enjoy the party because I was ...................................
questions.description: The past participle is used to say how people feel.
